item.title: Infant feeding ideology, expectation and reality
item.description: Status: Ongoing Co-PIs: Emily Emmott (UCL) & Sarah Myers (UCL & MPI). Collaborators: Rebecca Sear (LSHTM) & Sylvain Viguier (Graphcore, London) Funding: British Academy and Leverhulme Trust ​ BACKGROUND Since the early 1990’s, breastfeeding has been on the global public health agenda, yet breastfeeding rates remain low. The UK performs particularly poorly; while 73% of women initiate, only 47.3% are still breastfeeding at 6-8 weeks. Despite this, many women report a desire to breastfeed for longer.
